page.title: 08The River Thame continued
page.content: At Shabbington we saw many Emperor dragonflies and at Ickford Green Lestes and Hawkers.At Ickford it was very hard to get to the water,and very muddy.A water and mud sample had in it-river worm,water louse,pond snails,and a damsel nymph.It was quiet and breezy, we heard ripples,rustles,shovelling and swishing sounds.There are two hump- backed bridges over the river which are narrow with spaces to stand out of the way of traffic.The road over these bridges is very busy.Once a year there is a tug-of-war across the bridges and morris dancing.Next to the bridges is a {30ft pond which has never dried up},and an earthworks which is where Oliver Cromwell put cannon.The pond had duck- weed and flowering water lilies on the top and willows grow all along the riverside.On the bridge is carved 1685,it is a county boundary.
